info.title: SalesTim API
info.description: The unified Microsoft Teams Governance API. Visit our [Tech Hub](https://developers.salestim.com/api/) for more information.

tags.name: store
tags.description: Microsoft Teams and policy templates from the public template store. See our [Key Concepts / Template Store](https://developers.salestim.com/api/key-concepts.html#template-store) article for more information.

tags.name: catalog
tags.description: Microsoft Teams and policy templates from your corporate catalog. See our [Key Concepts / Corporate Catalog](https://developers.salestim.com/api/key-concepts.html#corporate-catalog) article for more information.

tags.name: connectedapps
tags.description: SalesTim Connected Apps. See our [Key Concepts / Connected Apps](https://developers.salestim.com/api/key-concepts.html#connected-apps) article for more information.

tags.name: apps
tags.description: SalesTim Virtual Apps that may access this API. See our [Key Concepts / Virtual Apps](https://developers.salestim.com/api/key-concepts.html#virtual-apps) article for more information.

tags.name: jobs
tags.description: Automated jobs that performs governance operations. See our [Key Concepts / Jobs](https://developers.salestim.com/api/key-concepts.html#jobs) article for more information.

tags.name: approvals
tags.description: Approval workflows used by provisioning jobs.

get.summary: Get a connected app integration (游댠 restricted to administrators)
get.description: Get a connected app integration associated with your tenant.

get.summary: Get all templates from the public template store (游니 Anonymous access)
get.description: Get all templates from the public [Template Store](https://store.salestim.com). Visit the [Template Manifests Repository](https://github.com/SalesTim/template-manifests) for more information.

get.summary: Get a store template from the public template store (游니 Anonymous access)
get.description: Get a specific templates from the public [Template Store](https://store.salestim.com). Visit the [Template Manifests Repository](https://github.com/SalesTim/template-manifests) for more information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the template to retreive

get.summary: Get store templates from a specific category (游니 Anonymous access)
get.description: Get templatesfrom a specific category from the public [Template Store](https://store.salestim.com). Visit the [Template Manifests Repository](https://github.com/SalesTim/template-manifests) for more information.

get.summary: Get all store categories from the public template store (游니 Anonymous access)
get.description: Get all categories from the public [Template Store](https://store.salestim.com). Visit the [Template Manifests Repository](https://github.com/SalesTim/template-manifests) for more information.

get.summary: Get all templates a user can see filtered by audience (游댏 Authenticated users)
get.description: Get all templates a user can see filtered by audience.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Optional. Default to 'en'. Language code to be used to filter the colection of templates, for instance 'en' or 'en-uk'.

get.summary: Get all templates from your corporate catalog (游댏 Authenticated users and apps)
get.description: Get all templates from your corporate catalog.

post.summary: Install a template from the public template store to your corporate catalog (游댠 restricted to administrators)
post.description: Install a template from the public template store to your corporate catalog.

requestBody.description: An identifier of the the template to be installed.

post.summary: Export a template from your corporate catalog (游댠 restricted to administrators)
post.description: Export a template from your corporate catalog.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the template to export.

get.summary: Get your virtual apps (游댠 restricted to administrators)
get.description: Get all virtual apps associated with your tenant. Please note, apps could be created using the POST verb on the /apps endpoint.

post.summary: Create a virtual app (游댠 restricted to administrators)
post.description: Create a new virtual app and get its generated secret. Please note, for obvious security reasons, the app secret will only be accessible once, in the response to this call, but it could later be regenerated using the POST verb on the /apps/{id}/regenerateSecret endpoint.

requestBody.description: List of properties and values to be updated.

get.summary: Get a virtual app (游댠 restricted to administrators)

put.summary: Update a virtual app (游댠 restricted to administrators)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the virtual app to update.

requestBody.description: List of properties and values to be updated. Please note that some properties are readonly and therefore will be ignored.

delete.summary: Delete a virtual app (游댠 restricted to administrators)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the virtual app to delete.

post.summary: Regenerate a virtual app secret (游댠 restricted to administrators)

get.summary: Get all jobs from your organization (游댠 restricted to administrators)
get.description: Get all jobs from your organization.

get.summary: Get information about a job (游댏 Authenticated users and apps)
get.description: Get detailed information about a job, including its status, progress, logs...

post.summary: Create a new provisioning job (游댏 Authenticated users and apps)
post.description: Create a new provisioning job by sending a ProvisioningRequest.

requestBody.description: A ProvisioningRequest object describing the job to execute.

get.summary: Get all approvals from your organization (游댠 restricted to administrators)
get.description: Get all approvals from your organization.

get.summary: Get your pending approvals (beeing the requester or an approver) (游댏 Authenticated users)
get.description: Get your pending approvals (beeing the requester or an approver).

post.summary: Approve a provisioning request (游댏 Authenticated users and apps)
Reject a provisioning request (游댏 Authenticated users and apps)

ConnectedAppsIntegration.description: An integration with a connected app.

StoreTemplates.description: A collection of templates from the public template store.

StoreTemplate.description: A template from the public template store.

StoreCategories.description: A collection of categories from the public template store.

StoreCategory.description: A category of templates from the public template store.

intro.description: Collection of localized category intros used in the category page.

slug.description: Category slug used for clean and seo-friendly urls.

CatalogTemplates.description: A collection of templates from your corporate catalog

CatalogTemplate.description: A template from your corporate catalog.

TemplateIdentifier.description: Object defining the ID of a template.

includeDrive.description: Defines if folders and files from the source team should be exported. (Default to false)

Apps.description: A collection of SalesTim virtual apps.

id.description: The virtual app ID, auto-generated at creation.

createdBy.description: The ID (From Azure AD) of the user that created the virtual app.

createdAt.description: The date of creation of the virtual app.

secret.description: The virtual app secret, auto-generated at creation. It may also be regenerated later. Be careful, this property is only available at creation or after an explicit regeneration.

enabled.description: The virtual app status, enabled or disabled.

Job.description: A job that performs some tasks asynchronously.

id.description: The job ID, auto-generated at creation.

progress.description: The job current progress between 0 and 100.

data.description: The job data (for instance a `ProvisioningRequest` object).

ProvisioningRequest.description: A request to provision a team based on a template from your corporate catalog.

requestedTeamName.description: The requested team name (as it would be filled by a user in our provisioning form). Please note, this name may not be the final one as it could be overwritten by a naming convention.

requestedTeamDescription.description: The requested team description (as it would be filled by a user in our provisioning form). Please note, this description may not be the final one as it could be overwritten by a naming convention.

requestedTeamWelcomeMessage.description: The requested team welcome message (as it would be filled by a user in our provisioning form). Please note, this welcome message may not be the final one as it could be overwritten by a naming convention.

requestedMembers.description: Requested members as an array of objects. Please note, users could be identified either by their ID, UPN or email, therefore you should only fill one of these properties. If multiple properties are filled, the first one will be used using the following order of priority, ID > UPN > email.

requestedOwners.description: Requested owners as an array of objects. Please note, users could be identified either by their ID, UPN or email, therefore you should only fill one of these properties. If multiple properties are filled, the first one will be used using the following order of priority, ID > UPN > email.

onBehalfOf.description: When creating a new request in `application mode`, indicates that the request should be processed on behalf of a specific user. Please note, users could be identified either by their ID, UPN or email, therefore you should only fill one of these properties. If multiple properties are filled, the first one will be used using the following order of priority, ID > UPN > email. Also, this property is ignored in `delegated mode`.

integration.description: Describes various properties from the external system and the optional related item this request originates from.

externalSystem.description: The external system this request originates from. This is an arbitrary string not tied to any enumeration or external reference. For instance "salesforce".

item.description: The item linked to this request.

id.description: The item ID in the external system. For instance in a SQL database, it could be a row ID, in a CRM, it could be the application-level record ID, in a web page it could be its URL.

entity.description: The kind of item in the external system. For instance in a SQL database, it could be the name of a table such as "orders", in a CRM, it could be the record type such as "accounts".

data.description: Item data that could be used as part of the templating process.

Approvals.description: A collection of approvals from your organization.

ApprovalInfos.description: Informations submitted by the approver of a provisioning workflow.

approvalMessage.description: Message sent by the approver to the requester in case of approval.

rejectionMessage.description: Message sent by the approver to the requester in case of rejection.

bearerAuth.description: A valid Microsoft 365 access_token issued by Azure AD.

appSecret.description: A valid virtual app secret issued by SalesTim.
appSecret.name: X-API-KEY

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token or API key are missing or invalid.

TooManyRequests.description: Too many requests. Your request has been throttled. Look at the "Retry-After" header and see our [Throttling](https://developers.salestim.com/api/throttling.html) article for more information.

InternalServerError.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request. See our [Authenticate with SalesTim API](https://developers.salestim.com/api/getting-started.html#authenticate-with-salestim-api) article for more information.
